name: dissect
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cut open something, especially a dead body or a plant, and study its structure: In biology classes we used to dissect rats.
to examine or consider something in detail: He's the kind of person who watches a movie and then dissects it for hours.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to cut apart the body of an animal or plant in order to study its structure: We had to dissect a frog in our biology class.
To dissect is also to examine something in detail: The more experts dissect his tax revision plan, the more inconsistencies turn up.
